intro: Biscutella tirolensis, commonly known as the Tyrolean biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained, sunny conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
